original: lam mnyam pa'ang rab tu shes /🔽lam nyam nga ba'ang rab tu shes /
analyzed: lam mnyam pa'ang rab tu shes / lam nyam nga ba'ang rab tu shes /

original: lam bde ba'ang rab tu shes /
analyzed: lam bde ba'ang rab tu shes /
translated: They know the pleasant path.

original: 'tsham pa'i lam yang rab tu shes /
analyzed: 'tsham pa'i lam yang rab tu shes /

original: lam chu che ba dang / chu med pa'ang rab tu shes /
analyzed: lam chu che ba dang / chu med pa'ang rab tu shes /

original: lam gyi dgong ma la dag kyang rab tu shes /🔽lam gyi tshugs dag kyang rab tu shes /
analyzed: lam gyi dgong ma la dag kyang rab tu shes / lam gyi tshugs dag kyang rab tu shes /
translated: They know the path with good resting places.🔽They know the path with good resting places.

original: lam 'khyog pa dag kyang rab tu shes /
analyzed: lam 'khyog pa dag kyang rab tu shes /
translated: They know the winding path.🔽They know the straight path.

original: lam drang po dag kyang rab tu shes; lam 'byung ba'ang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: lam drang po dag kyang rab tu shes; lam 'byung ba'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: They know the path that leads to the source.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: chos bcu po de dag dang ldan na /
analyzed: chos bcu po de dag dang ldan na /
translated: if they have those ten qualities,

original: byang chub sems dpa' lam la mkhas pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lam la mkhas pa rnams yin no //
translated: bodhisattvas are skilled in the path.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: chos bcu dang ldan na; byang chub sems dpa' lam ma log par ston pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: chos bcu dang ldan na; byang chub sems dpa' lam ma log par ston pa rnams yin no //
translated: if they have ten qualities, bodhisattvas teach the unmistaken path.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are those ten?

original: theg pa chen pos 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i lam ston gyi nyan thos kyi lam mi ston to //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i lam ston gyi nyan thos kyi lam mi ston to //
translated: For those beings who are to be guided by the Great Vehicle, they teach the bodhisattva path, not the śrāvaka path.

original: nyan thos kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la nyan thos kyi lam ston gyi byang chub sems dpa'i lam mi ston to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la nyan thos kyi lam ston gyi byang chub sems dpa'i lam mi ston to //
translated: For those beings who are to be guided by the śrāvakas, they teach the śrāvaka path, not the bodhisattva path.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis lam ston gyi rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mi ston to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis lam ston gyi rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mi ston to //
translated: For those beings who are to be guided by omniscience, they teach the path of omniscience, not the pratyekabuddha path.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la rang sangs rgyas kyi lam ston gyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam mi ston to //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la rang sangs rgyas kyi lam ston gyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam mi ston to //
translated: For those beings who are to be guided by the pratyekabuddhas, they teach the pratyekabuddha path, not the path of omniscience.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can rnams dang / chos su 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen @128a *//
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can rnams dang / chos su 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen @128a *//
translated: For those beings who are attached to the grasping of self and attached to the grasping of phenomena,

original: pa rnams la bdag med pa'i lam dang / stong pa nyid kyi lam ston gyi /
analyzed: pa rnams la bdag med pa'i lam dang / stong pa nyid kyi lam ston gyi /
translated: they teach the path of selflessness and the path of emptiness.

original: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag gi lam mi ston to //
analyzed: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag gi lam mi ston to //
translated: He does not teach the path of self, sentient being, life-force, nourished being, human, or person.

original: mtha' gnyis la gnas pa'i sems can rnams la mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i lam ston gyi mtha' gnyis la gnas pa mi ston to //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis la gnas pa'i sems can rnams la mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i lam ston gyi mtha' gnyis la gnas pa mi ston to //
translated: He teaches the path free from the two extremes to sentient beings who abide in the two extremes, but he does not teach the path of abiding in the two extremes.

original: sems g-yeng pa'i sems can rnams la zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam ston gyi g-yeng ba'i lam mi ston to //
analyzed: sems g-yeng pa'i sems can rnams la zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam ston gyi g-yeng ba'i lam mi ston to //
translated: He teaches the path of śamatha and vipaśyanā to sentient beings with distracted minds, but he does not teach the path of distraction.

original: spros pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams la de bzhin nyid kyi lam ston gyi byis pa spros pa la mngon par dga' ba'i lam mi ston to //
analyzed: spros pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams la de bzhin nyid kyi lam ston gyi byis pa spros pa la mngon par dga' ba'i lam mi ston to //
translated: He teaches the path of suchness to sentient beings who delight in conceptual elaborations, but he does not teach the path of childish delight in conceptual elaborations.

original: 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ston gyi 'khor ba'i lam mi ston to //
analyzed: 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ston gyi 'khor ba'i lam mi ston to //
translated: He teaches the path of nirvāṇa to sentient beings who delight in saṃsāra, but he does not teach the path of saṃsāra.

original: lam gol bar zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la lam srol ma dod pa ma yin pa dang / tsher ma med pa'i lam ston gyi nyon mongs pa'i tsher mas gang ba'i lam mi ston to //
analyzed: lam gol bar zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la lam srol ma dod pa ma yin pa dang / tsher ma med pa'i lam ston gyi nyon mongs pa'i tsher mas gang ba'i lam mi ston to //
translated: They do not show the wrong path to those who have entered the wrong path. They do not show a path that is full of the thorns of the afflictions to those who are looking for a path that is not full of thorns.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽chos bcu po de dag dang ldan na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / chos bcu po de dag dang ldan na /
translated: “Noble son,🔽bodhisattvas who possess ten qualities teach the right path.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lam log par ston pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lam log par ston pa rnams yin no //
translated: What are those ten?

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽chos bcu dang ldan na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / chos bcu dang ldan na /
translated: Noble son,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnams yin no //
translated: bodhisattvas who possess ten qualities are constantly in equipoise.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are those ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: lus la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas @128b so; ;tshor ba rnams dang / sems rnams dang / chos rnams dang / yul rnams dang / dgon pa rnams dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / gzhongs dang /
analyzed: lus la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas @128b so; ;tshor ba rnams dang / sems rnams dang / chos rnams dang / yul rnams dang / dgon pa rnams dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / gzhongs dang /
translated: They are mindful of the body and remain so. They are mindful of the feelings, the mind, and phenomena. They are mindful of the objects, the wilderness, the villages, the towns, the cities, the markets, and the regions.

original: yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor rnams dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / grags pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pas bslab pa bcas pa rnams dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor rnams dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / grags pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pas bslab pa bcas pa rnams dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: He is mindful and present in the retinue of the king, in the royal palace, in the acquisition of wealth, in the acquisition of respect, in the acquisition of fame, in the acquisition of praise, in the acquisition of verses, in the acquisition of the precepts of the Tathāgata, in the acquisition of the secondary afflictions,

original: yongs su nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas so //
analyzed: yongs su nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas so //
translated: in the acquisition of the afflictions, and in the acquisition of the secondary afflictions.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: de la ji ltar na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na /
translated: how is it that

original: byang chub sems dpa' lus la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas she na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lus la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas she na /
translated: bodhisattvas are mindful and present in their bodies?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' gang lus dang ldan pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis rab tu brtags shing yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' gang lus dang ldan pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis rab tu brtags shing yongs su spong ngo //
translated: bodhisattvas examine with their wisdom the unwholesome actions of the body and completely abandon them.

original: de 'og gi rkang pa'i mthil nas brtsams te yar la klad pa'i bar du lus kyi nyes pa la rtog go /
analyzed: de 'og gi rkang pa'i mthil nas brtsams te yar la klad pa'i bar du lus kyi nyes pa la rtog go /
translated: He then examines the faults of the body, from the soles of the feet upwards to the head.

original: lus la bdag med par yang rtog go /
analyzed: lus la bdag med par yang rtog go /
translated: He also examines the body as being without a self.

original: lus mi brtan pa dang / 'jig pa dang / chu rgyus kyis glags pa dang / dri mi zhim pa dang / dri nga ba dang / kha dog mi sdug par rtog ste /
analyzed: lus mi brtan pa dang / 'jig pa dang / chu rgyus kyis glags pa dang / dri mi zhim pa dang / dri nga ba dang / kha dog mi sdug par rtog ste /
translated: He examines the body as being unstable, perishable, full of veins, foul-smelling, stinking, and ugly.

original: de de ltar rtog pa'i tshe gang lus la lus su 'dod pa dang / lus la 'dod chags pa dang / lus la dga' ba dang / lus la bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / lus la zhen pa de dag mi 'byung ste /🔽de'i rgyu / @129a *//
analyzed: de de ltar rtog pa'i tshe gang lus la lus su 'dod pa dang / lus la 'dod chags pa dang / lus la dga' ba dang / lus la bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / lus la zhen pa de dag mi 'byung ste / de'i rgyu / @129a *//
translated: When he examines it in this way, the body is no longer desirable, nor is there any attachment to the body, any delight in the body, any possessiveness with regard to the body, or any clinging to the body.

original: de'i rkyen / de'i gzhis lus dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi dbang du 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /🔽gzhan du na lus dang ldan pa'i chos rnams de nyid kyi dbang du 'gyur te; de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i rkyen / de'i gzhis lus dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi dbang du 'gro bar mi 'gyur te / gzhan du na lus dang ldan pa'i chos rnams de nyid kyi dbang du 'gyur te; de ltar na /
translated: He does not come under the sway of any dharmas associated with the body, nor does he come under the sway of any causes, conditions, or bases associated with the body.🔽Rather, he comes under the sway of the dharmas associated with the body itself.

original: lus la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lus la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas pa'o //
translated: In this way, he remains focused on the body in terms of the body.

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: “What is the discernment of dharmas?

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba rnams la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas she na /
translated: How do Bodhisattvas remain with perfect mindfulness with regard to the feelings?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Here the Bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: tshor ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: tshor ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: “All feelings, whatever they may be,

original: sdug bsngal na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal na /
translated: are suffering.

original: byis pa phyin ci log gis phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams ni /
analyzed: byis pa phyin ci log gis phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams ni /
translated: The childish, deluded by error,

original: bde bar 'dzin te /
analyzed: bde bar 'dzin te /
translated: consider them to be happiness.

original: byis pa rmongs pa rnams sdug bsngal bde ba zhes bya bar 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: byis pa rmongs pa rnams sdug bsngal bde ba zhes bya bar 'dzin gyi /
translated: The ignorant, deluded childish consider suffering to be happiness.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni /
translated: But the noble ones understand🔽that all of them are suffering.

original: thams cad sdug bsngal bar thugs su chud do snyam nas de spang pa'i phyir nan tan du byed do //
analyzed: thams cad sdug bsngal bar thugs su chud do snyam nas de spang pa'i phyir nan tan du byed do //
translated: ” Thinking thus, he practices in order to abandon them.

original: sems can gzhan dag kyang bslab pa de nyid la 'god kyi /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag kyang bslab pa de nyid la 'god kyi /
translated: He also establishes other sentient beings in that very training.

original: bdag gis kyang de dag gi rjes su bslab par bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang de dag gi rjes su bslab par bya'o snyam ste /
translated: “I too should train in that,” he thinks.

original: de de ltar rtog pas tshor ba rnams la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas so //
analyzed: de de ltar rtog pas tshor ba rnams la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas so //
translated: Thus, reflecting in this way, he remains with perfect mindfulness with regard to the feelings.

original: de tshor ba dag la chags pa'ang med /
analyzed: de tshor ba dag la chags pa'ang med /
translated: He is not attached to the feelings.

original: khong khro ba'ang med cing de dag spang ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: khong khro ba'ang med cing de dag spang ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He is not angry, and he is engaged in abandoning them.

original: gzhan dag kyang bslab pa de nyid la 'god de /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bslab pa de nyid la 'god de /
translated: He also establishes others in that training.

original: de ltar na tshor ba rnams la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas so //🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba rnams la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas so // ji ltar na /
translated: Thus he is one who dwells in mindfulness with regard to feelings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems la dran pa shin tu @129b nye bar bzhag cing gnas she na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems la dran pa shin tu @129b nye bar bzhag cing gnas she na /
translated: How does he dwell in mindfulness with regard to the mind?

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: sems 'di ni /
analyzed: sems 'di ni /
translated: This mind

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: is attached to permanence in impermanence,

original: sdug bsngal la bde bar mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bde bar mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: attached to pleasure in suffering,

original: bdag med pa la bdag tu mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag tu mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: attached to self in non-self,

original: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: attached to beauty in impurity,

original: g-yo zhing mi brtan pa la myur du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo zhing mi brtan pa la myur du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: unstable and fickle,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'o //
translated: the root of the afflictions,

original: ngan song rnams kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: ngan song rnams kyi sgo'o //
translated: the door to the lower realms,

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gzhi'o //
translated: the basis of the secondary afflictions,

original: bde 'gro rnams chud son pa'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro rnams chud son pa'o //
translated: the destroyer of happy rebirths,🔽and the root of all misfortunes.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyi rkyen du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyi rkyen du gyur pa'o //
translated: the conditions for desire, aversion, and ignorance,

original: chos thams cad kyi bdag por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bdag por gyur pa'o //
translated: the lord of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad kyi thog mar sems 'gro ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi thog mar sems 'gro ste /
translated: the mind precedes all phenomena.

original: sems yongs su shes na /
analyzed: sems yongs su shes na /
translated: If the mind is understood,

original: chos thams cad kyang yongs su shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang yongs su shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: all phenomena are understood.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten sems kyis bris pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten sems kyis bris pa ste //
translated: Moreover, the world is written by the mind.

original: sems ni sems kyis mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems ni sems kyis mi mthong ngo //
translated: The mind is not seen by the mind.

original: dge ba'am yang na mi dge ba'i //
analyzed: dge ba'am yang na mi dge ba'i //
translated: Virtuous or nonvirtuous

original: las ni sems kyis bsags pa'o //
analyzed: las ni sems kyis bsags pa'o //
translated: actions are accumulated by the mind.

original: sems ni 'gal me lta bur 'khor //
analyzed: sems ni 'gal me lta bur 'khor //
translated: The mind circles like a firebrand.

original: sems ni rta ltar 'khyams pa yin //
analyzed: sems ni rta ltar 'khyams pa yin //
translated: The mind wanders like a horse.

original: sems ni nags kyi me ltar tshig /
analyzed: sems ni nags kyi me ltar tshig /
translated: The mind burns like a forest fire.

original: sems ni chu chen bzhin du skyed //
analyzed: sems ni chu chen bzhin du skyed //
translated: The mind grows like a great river.

original: de de ltar rtog pas sems la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas te; sems kyi dbang du mi 'gro'o /
analyzed: de de ltar rtog pas sems la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas te; sems kyi dbang du mi 'gro'o /
translated: Thus, by contemplating in this way, he remains with perfect mindfulness in the mind, and does not fall under the influence of the mind.

original: sems nyid de'i dbang du 'gro ste /
analyzed: sems nyid de'i dbang du 'gro ste /
translated: He falls under the influence of the mind itself.

original: sems nyid de'i dbang du gyur pas chos thams cad dbang du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: sems nyid de'i dbang du gyur pas chos thams cad dbang du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Since the mind is mastered, all phenomena are mastered.

original: de ltar na /🔽byang chub sems @130a *//
analyzed: de ltar na / byang chub sems @130a *//
translated: Thus,

original: dpa' sems la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas so //🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: dpa' sems la dran pa shin tu nye bar bzhag cing gnas so // ji ltar na /
translated: bodhisattvas are mindful and present in the mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams la dran pa nye bar bzhag cing gnas she na /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta ste /🔽'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa dang / de dag la gnas pa gzhan dag la 'di dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams la dran pa nye bar bzhag cing gnas she na / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta ste / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa dang / de dag la gnas pa gzhan dag la 'di dag ni /
translated: How are bodhisattvas mindful and present in phenomena?

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams so; ;zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /🔽de 'dod chags kyi gnyen po la sten /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams so; ;zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te / de 'dod chags kyi gnyen po la sten /
translated: Here, bodhisattvas know, just as it is, that these phenomena, such as desire, anger, and ignorance, and other things that are based on them,🔽are nonvirtuous.

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi gnyen po la sten cing de dag spang ba'i phyir brtson pa yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi gnyen po la sten cing de dag spang ba'i phyir brtson pa yin no //
translated: They rely on the antidotes to desire, anger, and ignorance, and they strive to abandon them.

original: chos 'di dag ni /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni /
translated: These phenomena

original: dge ba'o // zhes bya bar shes nas chos de dag la sems gtong zhing dran pa nye bar gzhog ste /
